intro: Orthosiphon adornatus, commonly known as the velvet leaf or silverleaf plant, is a member of the Lamiaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its hairy, silver-green leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its flowers are small and clustered, usually in whorled arrangements, and are typically white or pale pink in color. Orthosiphon adornatus is valued for its ornamental beauty and has traditional uses in herbal medicine.
